meanings.definition: The quality of being calm and composed, especially in difficult situations.
meanings.sent1: Her imperturbability during the storm impressed everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: His imperturbability in the face of danger made him a reliable leader.
meanings.sent3: The imperturbability of the cat as it faced a noisy vacuum cleaner was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood with imperturbability, unmoved by the passing of time.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's imperturbability helped the students feel safe during the lockdown drill.

meanings.definition: The state of being unshakably calm and collected.
meanings.sent1: The imperturbability of the lake's surface mirrored her inner peace.
meanings.sent2: His imperturbability in the midst of chaos was truly admirable.
meanings.sent3: The imperturbability of the sloth hanging upside down was a funny sight.
meanings.sent4: The imperturbability of the old tree roots symbolized strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The imperturbability of the nurse calmed the anxious patient before surgery.

meanings.definition: The ability to remain unruffled and undisturbed by external events.
meanings.sent1: His imperturbability in the face of criticism was remarkable.
meanings.sent2: The imperturbability of the monk in meditation was inspiring to all.
meanings.sent3: The imperturbability of the robot chef as it cooked was oddly amusing.
meanings.sent4: The imperturbability of the lighthouse keeper guided ships safely through the night.
meanings.sent5: The imperturbability of the detective helped solve the case amidst chaos.
